thread.title: AG Kane law license suspension in effect
thread.title_full: AG Kane law license suspension in effect

title: AG Kane law license suspension in effect
text:
AG Kane law license suspension in effect 
Updated: Thu, Oct 22 2015, 08:30 AM 
By: CBS 21 Web Staff HARRISBURG, Pa. -- As of midnight Thursday, the top cop in Pennsylvania is no longer able to practice law.The indefinite temporary suspension of Attorney General Kathleen Kane's law license went into effect at midnight, following a state Supreme Court order issuing the suspension.Kane will remain on the job, saying Wednesday through her spokesperson, Chuck Ardo, that 98 percent of her work won't be impacted by the license suspension."She will continue being the administrator, she will have control of the budget, she can assign personnel," Ardo said. "The things she can't do will be easier to determine than things she can't."Kane won't be able to sign off on some documents, like search warrants and wire taps, which will require another attorney's signature.Still, despite the business-as-usual attitude, there are some in the office that see the license suspension as playing a bigger role on day-to-day duties."There are attorneys upstairs who believe that the attorney general's duties will be more impacted than she believes," Ardo said.Kane was charged in August with perjury and other counts related to allegedly leaking grand jury testimony to a Philadelphia newspaper in an effort to embarrass political foes.They are accusations Kane has denies.Still, many top state leaders, including Gov. Tom Wolf, have called for her to step aside from office.Central Pennsylvania political activist Gene Stilp said residents should be concerned that Kane will continue to collect a paycheck while she can't practice law.
